Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.board.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
A simple implementation of the game board.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SimpleBoard()
    Constructs a new SimpleBoard, initializing its dimensions, score, brick generator, and brick rotator.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ClearRow
    clearRows()
    Clears any completed rows from the board and plays a sound effect if rows were cleared.
    boolean
    createNewBrick()
    Creates a new brick and places it on the board at the top center.
    int[][]
    getBoardMatrix()
    Gets the current state of the board as a 2D integer matrix.
    Score
    getScore()
    Gets the current score object.
    ViewData
    getViewData()
    Gets the data required for the view to render the game state, including the current brick's shape, position, next bricks, ghost brick position, and held brick.
    void
    holdCurrentBrick()
    Swaps the current brick with the held brick.
    BrickType
    mergeBrickToBackground()
    Merges the current brick into the board's background.
    boolean
    moveBrickDown()
    Moves the current brick one step down.
    boolean
    moveBrickLeft()
    Moves the current brick one step to the left.
    boolean
    moveBrickRight()
    Moves the current brick one step to the right.
    void
    newGame()
    Starts a new game, resetting the board, score, and brick states.
    boolean
    rotateLeftBrick()
    Rotates the current brick to the left.

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Creates a new brick and places it on the board at the top center. Resets the hold usage flag for the new brick.
      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the new brick immediately intersects with existing blocks (game over condition), false otherwise.

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Gets the data required for the view to render the game state, including the current brick's shape, position, next bricks, ghost brick position, and held brick.
      Specified by:
      getViewData in interface Board
      Returns:
      a ViewData object containing all necessary information for rendering.

    • holdCurrentBrick

      public void holdCurrentBrick()
      Swaps the current brick with the held brick. If no brick is currently held, the current brick is moved to hold and a new brick is generated. This action can only be performed once per turn.
      Specified by:
      holdCurrentBrick in interface Board

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public BrickType mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current brick into the board's background. This typically happens when a brick lands.
      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board
      Returns:
      the type of the merged brick.

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Clears any completed rows from the board and plays a sound effect if rows were cleared.
      Specified by:
      clearRows in interface Board
      Returns:
      a ClearRow object containing information about the cleared rows.
